paragraph.value: We perform hyperparameter optimisation and make comparisons among our systems, including GCN + Bi-LSTM (GCN-based), CNN + attention + Bi-LSTM (Att-based), and their combination using a highway layer (H-combined) in Table 1. Systems are evaluated using two types of precision, recall and F-score measures: strict MWE-based scores (every component of an MWE should be correctly tagged to be considered as true positive), and token-based scores (a partial match between a predicted and a gold MWE would be considered as true positive). We report results for all MWEs as well as discontinuous ones specifically. GCN-based
in terms of MWE-based F-score in three out of four languages. Combining GCN with attention using highway networks results in further improvements for EN, FR and FA. The H-combined model consistently
for all languages. GCN and H-combined models each show

with regard to discontinuous MWEs, regardless of the proportion of such expressions. The overall results confirm our assumption that a hybrid architecture can mitigate errors of individual models and bolster their strengths.

Note: Since the phrase "non ï¿½ riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno" (which translates to "is not recognized as an internal or external command") seems irrelevant to the task description and does not provide any comparative, superlative, or explicit values to be annotated, it has been omitted in the output.
